question.title: Why is my Quartz Scheduler job not running?
question.body:
I am new to Quartz and I am trying to get a simple job to run, using an XML to configure it. I am using Quartz 1.4.0. Here is the code:

jobscheduler_init.properties

#============================================================================
# Configure Main Scheduler Properties  
#============================================================================

org.quartz.scheduler.instanceName = StepQuartzScheduler
org.quartz.scheduler.instanceId = 1

#============================================================================
# Configure ThreadPool  
#============================================================================

org.quartz.threadPool.class = org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool
org.quartz.threadPool.threadCount = 3
org.quartz.threadPool.threadPriority = 5

#============================================================================
# Configure JobStore  
#============================================================================

org.quartz.jobStore.misfireThreshold = 5000

org.quartz.jobStore.class = org.quartz.simpl.RAMJobStore


#============================================================================
# Configure Datasources  
#============================================================================

org.quartz.dataSource.myDS.driver = net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver
org.quartz.dataSource.myDS.URL = jdbc:sqlserver:[DB_NAME];autoReconnect=true;sendStringParametersAsUnicode=false
org.quartz.dataSource.myDS.user = [USERNAME]
org.quartz.dataSource.myDS.password = [PASSWORD]
org.quartz.dataSource.myDS.maxConnections = 5

#============================================================================
# Configure Plugins 
#============================================================================

org.quartz.plugin.triggHistory.class = org.quartz.plugins.history.LoggingJobHistoryPlugin

org.quartz.plugin.jobInitializer.class = org.quartz.plugins.xml.JobInitializationPlugin
org.quartz.plugin.jobInitializer.fileName = jobs.xml
org.quartz.plugin.jobInitializer.overWriteExistingJobs = true
org.quartz.plugin.jobInitializer.failOnFileNotFound = true

jobs.xml (this is probably the part that is incorrect)

<quartz xmlns="http://www.quartzscheduler.org/ns/quartz" version="1.4.0">


<schedule>
    <job>
        <job-detail>
            <name>MyJob</name>
            <job-class>src.myJob</job-class>
            <volatility>false</volatility>
            <durability>false</durability>
            <recover>false</recover>            
            <job-data-map allows-transient-data="true">
                <entry>
                    <key>myKey</key>
                    <value>myValue</value>
                </entry>
            </job-data-map>
        </job-detail>
            </job>
        
        <trigger>
            <cron>
                <name>MyJobTrigger</name>
                <job-name>MyJob</job-name>
                <cron-expression>0 0/1 * * * ?</cron-expression> <!-- every 1 minute -->
            </cron>
        </trigger>
</schedule>

MyJob.java

import java.util.List;

import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
import org.quartz.Job;
import org.quartz.JobExecutionContext;
import org.quartz.JobExecutionException;

public class MyJob implements Job {
    private static Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(MyJob.class);
    
    @Override
    public void execute(JobExecutionContext context) throws JobExecutionException {
        System.out.println("running now");
        LOG.info("running job now");        
    }
}

Of course this code is supposed to do something with my DB, but I wanted to get it to fire first before I implement the logic. I don't get any sort of error when it run the application, just...nothing.

Thank you in advance for any assistance.

question_comments.body: It is in a package.  I just shortened the name because the package path has my company name in it.  The line says <job-class>com.[path].util.MyJob</job-class>
Correct the class as <job-class>MyJob</job-class>,. Or, if it's in a package (e.g. com.example.jobs.MyJob), it should be: <job-class>com.example.jobs.MyJob</job-class>

Tagging a question as "java" or "xml" implies that you're looking for help from people who know about Java or XML. They aren't going to be able to help you unless they know Quartz, so you're targetting the wrong audience.
